alert.note: Alert for Humboldt (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 13 at 11:13PM PDT until further notice by NWS Elko
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 130 AM PDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of northwest Nevada, including the following county, Humboldt. * WHEN...Until 130 AM PDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1113 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Due to previous heavy rainfall from earlier today, the ground is very saturated and it will not take much rain to cause runoff and minor flooding. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in Intersection of U.S. 95 and SR140. Between 0.1 and 0.2 inches of rain have fallen. - Intersection of U.S. 95 and SR140 is the most likely place to experience minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Over the intersection of US Highway 95 and SR140 in north- central Humboldt County - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
